snippet: The increase matched economists’ expectations, spurred by the rising cost of rents and gasoline....
abstract: Labor Dept says Consumer Price Index rose 0.3 percent in September after climbing 0.2 percent in August; jump is biggest rise in five months.
lead_paragraph: The increase matched economists’ expectations, spurred by the rising cost of rents and gasoline.

headline.main: September Consumer Prices Made Biggest Gain in Five Months
headline.print_headline: Biggest Gain for Consumer Prices in 5 Months
